byline.original: By JACK EWING and LIZ ALDERMAN
byline.contributor:
Liz Alderman reported from
Paris. Stephen Castle contributed
reporting from Brussels and Gaia
Pianigiani from Rome.

abstract: Fears grow that latest plan to solve the European debt crisis is another example of European leaders not doing enough, even as officials iron out details of plan; under new plan, banks would be required to bolster their reserves by 100 billion euros ($139 billion) for the euro area as a whole, an amount at the low end of what analysts say would remove doubts about the creditworthiness of European banks.
snippet: Fears are growing that the latest rescue will be another minimal step that falls short of a solution.
lead_paragraph: Fears are growing that the latest rescue will be another minimal step that falls short of a solution.

headline.main: New Unease for Europe’s Rescue Plan
headline.print_headline: New Unease For Europe’s Rescue Plan
